info.description:
Dig into our logoraisr API reference documentation. We also offer an OpenAPI specification to allow easy integration into your systems. You can download the json file by clicking on the download button.


OpenAPI 2.0 Validation Status
info.title: API docs | logoraisr.com

get.description: This GET-Method returns the URL where the preview image of uploaded file can downloaded from.

parameters.description: Id of the file for which the preview_img_url is generated.
parameters.name: file_id

get.summary: Get preview image of uploaded file

x-code-samples.source:
import requests



# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}


resp = request.get('https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/previews/{file_id}/', headers=headers)
print(resp.json())

get.description: This GET-Method lists all on logoraisr available processes.

x-code-samples.source:
import requests



# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}


resp = request.get('https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/processes/', headers=headers)
print(resp.json())

get.description: This GET-Method lists the user's projects.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/projects/' \
-H "Authorization:Token your_api_key" \ 
-H "content-type:application/json" \
 -d processes=logo-super-resolution \
 -d file_id=string \
 -d project_title=string \
 -d paid=true \

post.description: This POST-Method creates a new project.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X POST 'https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/projects/' \
-H "Authorization:Token your_api_key" \ 
-H "content-type:application/json" \
 -d processes=logo-super-resolution \
 -d file_id=string \
 -d project_title=string \
 -d paid=true \

get.description: This GET-Method returns a specific project.

x-code-samples.source:
import requests



# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}


resp = request.get('https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/projects/{project_number}/', headers=headers)
print(resp.json())

get.description: This GET method lists the user's reports.

x-code-samples.source:
import requests



# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}


resp = request.get('https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/reports/', headers=headers)
print(resp.json())

post.description: This POST-Method creates a new report.

x-code-samples.source:
import requests



# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}



print(resp.json())

get.description: This GET-Method returns the details of a specific report.

x-code-samples.source:
import requests



# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}


resp = request.get('https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/reports/{report_number}/', headers=headers)
print(resp.json())

get.description: This GET-Method returns the URL where the result can downloaded from.

parameters.description: Id of the result_file for which the result_file_url is generated.
parameters.name: result_file_id

get.summary: Get the result from image processing

x-code-samples.source:
import requests



# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}


resp = request.get('https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/results/{result_file_id}/', headers=headers)
print(resp.json())

post.description: This POST-Method uploads a new file on the server.

file.description: File which should be uploaded. Supported file types are: JPEG and PNG

x-code-samples.source:
import requests

files = '/path/to/your/logo.png'

# provide your API token here
headers = {'Authorization:Token your_api_key'}


resp = request.post('https://api.logoraisr.com/rest-v1/uploads/', files=files, headers=headers)
print(resp.json())

number_of_pixel.description: Number of pixels that holds this color.
number_of_pixel.title: Number of pixel

percentage.description: Percentage of pixels that holds this color.
percentage.title: Percentage

file_id.description: Returns the file_id. To apply processes to the uploaded file, this file_id must be referenced in the API-calls.
file_id.title: File id

preview_img_url.description: Url from which the preview file can be downloaded.
preview_img_url.title: Preview img url

crop.description: Crops the image according to the specified mechanism. If you specify the size "WidthexHeight", the image will be cropped centered. If coordinates "x1,y1,x2,y2" are given, the image is cropped according to the coordinates. The image will be cropped to the size of the stories if "faces" are specified as. Example Centered: "crop": "200x300". Example Region: "crop": "200,300,150,300". Example Faces: "crop": "faces".
crop.title: Crop

flip.description: Flips the image around the horizontal axis, from top to bottom. Example: "flip": true
flip.title: Flip

mirror.description: Mirrors the image around the vertical axis, i.e. from right to left. Example: "mirror": true
mirror.title: Mirror

processing_algorithm.description: Schl√ºssel welcher Verarbeitungs-Algorithmus angewendet wird. Zur Auswahl stehen "logo-to-vector", "logo-super-resolution", "logo-segmentation" und "image-processing".
processing_algorithm.title: Processing algorithm

resize.description: Changes the size of the image according to the specified size. Example: "resize": "200x300".
resize.title: Resize

rotate.description: Rotates the image around the center according to the specified degree. Example: "rotate": 90
rotate.title: Rotate

created.description: The Date when the project was created.
created.title: Created

file_id.description: Id of the file on which the process was applied.
file_id.title: File id

process_id.description: Process which should applied. Processes are "color-classification".
process_id.title: Process id

project_title.description: Name of the project with which it was saved.
project_title.title: Project title

result_file_id.description: Id of the result file which the process created.
result_file_id.title: Result file id

file_id.description: Id of the file on which the process is to be applied.
file_id.title: File id

project_title.description: Name of the project with which it is saved.
project_title.title: Project title

result_file_id.description: Id of the result_file. This id must be specified to create the result_file_url.
result_file_id.title: Result file id

created.description: The Date when the report was created.
created.title: Created

file_id.description: Id of the file on which the report was applied.
file_id.title: File id

process_id.description: Process_id of the process which was applied. Processes are "color-classification".
process_id.title: Process id

result_id.description: Result_id of the result which was created.
result_id.title: Result id

file_id.description: Id of the file on which the process is to be applied.
file_id.title: File id

process.description: Process which should applied. Processes are "color-classification".
process.title: Process

created.description: The Date when the project was created.
created.title: Created

file_id.description: Id of the file on which the process was applied.
file_id.title: File id

processing_algorithm.description: Process which was applied. Processes are "color-classification".
processing_algorithm.title: Processing algorithm

report_number.description: Number of the report which was created.
report_number.title: Report number

result_file_url.description: Url from which the result file can be downloaded.
result_file_url.title: Result file url
